intro: Anerincleistus brevidens, commonly known as the short-leafed anerincleistus, is a rare and lesser-known plant species within the Arecaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-green flowers that bloom during the late spring or early summer. Its fruit is a small, fibrous capsule that contains several winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. Due to its limited geographic distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
